channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16181] Allow snapshot of hbase:backup table
item.description: Snapshot of HBase system tables is not supported, we need either move hbase:backup into different name space or fix snapshots.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Now, all tables under "hbase" namespace could not be token a snapshot, i think it is unreasonable. Only meta table need to forbid snapshot.

+1 for fix snapshots.
patch v1. cc: Ted Yu
The patch allows to snapshot hbase:backup system table only.

What about other system tables ?
It would be nice to have ability taking snapshots of other system tables.
For some reason, snapshotting of system tables was prohibited. That was explicitly disabled in HBASE-8408. I do not know why.

Francis Liu Matteo Bertozzi:
Can you remind me why snapshot of system tables is disabled ?

If there is certain technical limitation, we should start addressing it.

Thanks

back then the only system table were (meta, ns, acls).
if you restore one of those chances are that you are corrupting your system.
e.g. restoring meta will not remove or restore regions of the other tables, so the things that are on disk are not aligned with the meta information.

don't you have the same problem with backups? if you restore an old backup table, files on disk may be gone or files may be there but not referenced.

Matteo Bertozzi, we need snapshots for hbase:backup table to implement fault tolerance during backup procedure. Before backup starts we snapshot hbase:backup. If backup fails, we clean up all files/dirs and restore hbase:backup from snapshot.

the fix on the snapshot side is easy. just put a blacklist instead of excluding all sys-tables.

but can you elaborate more on the above? why do you have to snapshot the full backup table when you are taking a new backup?
don't you just need to keep track of which rows are you adding to the backup table and remove those in case of rollback?

Yes, this is what I did - whitelisted hbase:backup table only.

As for keeping track of all changes in hbase:backup, this requires much more coding. Snapshotting is more elegant solution.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
As mentioned above, should black list be introduced so that more system tables are allowed to be snapshotted ?

The license header in TestSystemTableBackup is not formatted in the same way as other files.

Vlad:
Mind fixing it ?

Thanks
Ok.

w.r.t. the new test, on Mac it took 113.497 sec.
Can the test be simplified ?

Meaning, without the fix in ClientSnapshotDescriptionUtils.java, the snapshot of hbase:backup would trigger exception.
Otherwise the snapshot would be successful, resulting in assertions to pass.
So the test just verifies that snapshot on hbase:backup is allowed.

Since HBASE-15227 depends on this change, the new test doesn't seem necessary.
Test coverage would be provided by HBASE-15227.

-1 overall
